main event: A military refueling mission involving KC-97 aircraft reported sightings of an unidentified object over Newfoundland on July 5, 1955.
interesting points: The object was initially sighted at 0705Z, hovered at a 10 o'clock position, and climbed to an estimated altitude of 40-50,000 feet, The object exhibited rapid directional changes and was lost on radar after moving fast, A fighter jet was scrambled but obtained negative results, While one object was reported on radar, five smaller objects were simultaneously detected below the KC-97, The object demonstrated erratic movement and was described as resembling a bright light before disappearing.
witness description: military personnel including pilots and radar operators
